file_content.text: Those adrenals were more than satisfactory, I--our troops will benefit greatly from their synthesis.
You have the formula samples? Oh, please tell me you have them?
I do.
Hold on, this isn't free.
Yes, I--uh....
Don't expect anything else.
Yes, yes, next time--
Here. My command's entire recreational spending allocation. Please excuse me, I--I should really see to securing these.
I would advise capturing those adrenals before the Republic moves them, or worse, uses them all.
Finding Quesh to your liking? It's an acquired locale.
If your group is on a tour of the facilities, you should sample what luxuries this planet has to offer.
My lord, may I suggest sampling what luxuries this planet has to offer while you're here?
My sole luxury here will be grinding the Republic under my heel.
I'm not here for pleasures.
Excellent, my lord. I know just the place where you can do just that.
How very helpful. What do you recommend?
Excellent idea.
Intelligence taking an interest in what this planet has to offer? If you don't mind mixing business with pleasure, I can make some recommendations.
If you're suggesting dereliction of duty, that's an executable offense.
You're setting a poor example.
There are certain fringe benefits to being stationed on a Hutt-controlled planet; you should try the local fare.
I avoid letting the Hutts get their hooks in me.
Spice isn't my thing.
I'm not talking about anything so crude as spice. Quesh is the new center of the galaxy's adrenal industry.
Fine, point the way.
I think I'll pass.
I'm not suggesting anything against regulations, of course, it's just that Quesh now produces the highest grade adrenals and stims in the galaxy.
You can find all the latest adrenal formulas available right here in our civilian markets... but, if you're interested in something truly cutting-edge....
You've heard of the Three Families? The rebellious Hutts who've chosen to ally with the Republic?
Yes.
Yes.
Fill me in.
The Three Families broke all ties with the Hutt Cartel to corner the market on adrenals. They've allied with the Republic for protection.
Spit it out.
We intercepted a communication from the Three Families indicating that they've moved an experimental formula to Attis Station for final testing.
Industry rumors about the formula's effects are nothing short of miraculous. Heightened awareness, near immunity to fatigue or exertion, mild euphoria. It's perfect.
I want to acquire some samples for synthesis, to distribute it among our troops, after I've tested its safety, of course.
These delusions of grandeur pale before the power of the Force.
It's a crutch for the weak.
Of course, my lord, but it would bestow impressive benefits to those of us who lack your natural ability.
I'd be interested in sampling this wonder of yours.
Sounds worth a try.
As would I, my lord, and its impact as a force multiplier would be astronomical.
I could look into getting this formula, if it's worth something to you.
Are you making an offer?
Oh, it most definitely is.
Taking it would deprive the enemy of a combat enhancement if nothing else.
That's a dangerous advantage.
My thoughts exactly. If the Republic were to distribute this to their local forces, they'd have an army of supersoldiers at their disposal.
I don't see us capturing the formula through conventional assault. The army would be most appreciative if you acquired this formula for us.
Fine, fine, I'll handle it.
You'll find Attis Station nearby. It's a Republic research facility disguised as a simple outpost, so it'll be better protected than it appears.
Liar. [Refuse quest]
Find someone else to feed your habit.
Ahem, merely a suggestion. If I may be of service, I'll be here.
Ugh, these stims my adjutant brought are absolute rubbish.
